title: 103_hr958
content: There is no information provided in the prev_chunk, so the curr_chunk cannot be summarized. Section 32 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to allow a tax credit for eligible individuals based on earned income, with a limit of $5,714. The tax credit is based on adjusted gross income exceeding $9,000, with percentages specified in subsection (b). The tax credit percentage for eligible individuals with qualifying children is 23.0% for 1 child, 29.0% for 2 children, and 33.01% for 3 or more children. Transitional percentages apply for the taxable year beginning in 1993. The tax credit percentage for eligible individuals with qualifying children is 18.5% for 1 child, 23.5% for 2 children, and 28.5% for 3 or more children. Amendments are made to various sections of the tax code, including changes to subsection references and coordination with medical deductions. Section 213 is also amended by striking subsection (f). Amendments are made to section 213 by striking subsection (f) and making changes to section 3507(c)(2) regarding the percentage of earned income for eligible individuals. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1992. SEC. 2 amends the Internal Revenue Code to require the Secretary to provide an explanation of advance payment provisions along with any tax refund to eligible individuals. Effective December 31, 1993.
